 When the animation reaches the end and the repeat count is INFINTE_REPEAT or a positive value, the animation restarts from the beginning.

 Requests that the content being animated be kept in its current Z order.
static const int32_t ZORDER_TOP
 Requests that the content being animated be forced on top of all other content for the duration of the animation.

 Requests that the content being animated be forced under all other content for the duration of the animation.

Detailed Description

Abstraction for an Animation that can be applied to Widget, Surfaces, or other objects.

See the gaia/core/Animation animation folder description file.

 Animation *anim = new AlphaAnimation(0.0f,1.0f);
 AccelerateInterpolator *ip = new AccelerateInterpolator();

 anim->setStartOffset(500);
 anim->setDuration(1500);
 anim->setRepeatCount(0);
 anim->setInterpolator(ip);

 ImageWidget *ImWidg = new ImageWidget(this);
 ImWidg->startAnimation(anim);

 delete anim;
 delete ip;

Definition at line 33 of file Animation.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void gaia::core::Animation::applyTransformation ( float  interpolatedTime,
Transformation *  t 
) [virtual]

Helper for getTransformation.

Subclasses should implement this to apply their transforms given an interpolation value. Implementations of this method should always replace the specified Transformation or document they are doing otherwise.

Parameters:
interpolatedTimeThe value of the normalized time (0.0 to 1.0) after it has been run through the interpolation function.
tThe Transformation object to fill in with the current transforms.
virtual int64_t gaia::core::Animation::getDuration ( ) const [virtual]

How long this animation should last.

Returns:
the duration in milliseconds of the animation
virtual int64_t gaia::core::Animation::getStartOffset ( ) const [virtual]

When this animation should start, relative to StartTime.

Returns:
the start offset in milliseconds
virtual bool gaia::core::Animation::hasEnded ( ) const [virtual]

Indicates whether this animation has ended or not.

Returns:
true if the animation has ended, false otherwise
virtual bool gaia::core::Animation::hasStarted ( ) const [virtual]

Indicates whether this animation has started or not.

Returns:
true if the animation has started, false otherwise
void gaia::core::Animation::setAnimationListener ( AnimationListener *  al)

Binds an animation listener to this animation.

The animation listener is notified of animation events such as the end of the animation or the repetition of the animation.

Parameters:
althe animation listener to be notified
virtual bool gaia::core::Animation::setDuration ( int64_t  durationMillis) [virtual]

How long this animation should last.

The duration cannot be negative.

Parameters:
durationMillisDuration in milliseconds
virtual void gaia::core::Animation::setFillAfter ( bool  fillAfter) [virtual]

If fillAfter is true, the transformation that this animation performed will persist when it is finished.

Defaults to false if not set. Note that this applies to individual animations and when using an AnimationSet to chain animations.

Parameters:
fillAftertrue if the animation should apply its transformation after it ends
virtual void gaia::core::Animation::setFillBefore ( bool  fillBefore) [virtual]

If fillBefore is true, this animation will apply its transformation before the start time of the animation.

Note that this applies when using an AnimationSet to chain animations. The transformation is not applied before the AnimationSet itself starts.

Parameters:
fillBeforetrue if the animation should apply its transformation before it starts
virtual void gaia::core::Animation::setInterpolator ( IInterpolator *  i) [virtual]

Sets the acceleration curve for this animation.

Defaults to a linear interpolation.

Parameters:
iThe interpolator which defines the acceleration curve
virtual void gaia::core::Animation::setRepeatCount ( int32_t  repeatCount) [virtual]

Sets how many times the animation should be repeated.

If the repeat count is 0, the animation is never repeated. If the repeat count is greater than 0 or INFINITE, the repeat mode will be taken into account. The repeat count is 0 by default.

Parameters:
repeatCountthe number of times the animation should be repeated
virtual void gaia::core::Animation::setRepeatMode ( int32_t  repeatMode) [virtual]

Defines what this animation should do when it reaches the end.

This setting is applied only when the repeat count is either greater than 0 or INFINITE. Defaults to RESTART.

Parameters:
repeatModeRESTART or REVERSE
virtual void gaia::core::Animation::setStartOffset ( int64_t  startOffset) [virtual]

When this animation should start relative to the start time.

This is most useful when composing complex animations using an AnimationSet where some of the animations components start at different times.

Parameters:
startOffsetWhen this Animation should start, in milliseconds from the start time of the root AnimationSet.

Can be used as the start time to indicate the start time should be the current time.

This can is useful for short animations.
